name: European Association for the Taps and Valves Industry
membership: CEIR is associate member of Orgalime, the European engeneering industries association, and has close ties with VMA and PMI in USA.
goal:
The European Association for the Taps and Valves Industry (CEIR) was formed in 1959 as the European federation of national manufacturer associations. CEIR gathers together a large number of European manufacturers of valves and fittings in 2 Product Committees (sanitary valves, building valves and industrial valves). CEIR represents 12 National Associations in the EU, Russia, Turkey, and Switzerland, as well as 14 member companies from Denmark, Spain, Germany and Switzerland.

CEIR supports the principles of a free economy and private enterprise in Europe as well as on a global basis.

CEIR represents the common economic, technical and environmental interests of European valve manufacturers, in particular towards international and European authorities and in economic and commercial circles.

CEIR facilitates reciprocal contacts at a European level within the valve industry.

CEIR takes part in research work, testing and other activities and promotes these in order to contribute to technical development in the valve industry.

CEIR supports the development of standards related to safety, construction and quality of valves within the framework of European and international standards bodies (e.g. CEN and ISO).

The activities of CEIR are carried out by 2 Technical Committees, a Marketing Committee, a Technical and a General Secretariat. The work is done by companies and associations' experts on a voluntary basis. The secretariat staff is shared with other associations.
interests: Business and Industry, Competition, Consumers, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, Institutional affairs, Public Health, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade
euInitiatives:
- Technical legislation: Directive 2006/14 on Machinery, LVD (Directive 2014/35), ATEX (Directive 2014/34), PED (Directive 2014/68)

- Environment: Drinking Water Directive (materials in contact with drinking water), water and energy labelling of taps and showers, European Performance of Building Directive, REACH Regulation, Resource efficiency

- Horizontal matters: industrial policy, market surveillance, digitalisation, Internal Market for industrial products
